author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
https://github.com/curtd/ForwardMethods.jl

https://docs.juliahub.com/Lazy/mi7Ul/0.15.0/autodocs/#Lazy.@forward-Tuple%7BAny,Any%7D

do we really need so many method forwarding macros?

[noblock]

Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I am not a fan of Lazy.jl because it comes with a whole other lot of functionality and it is unmaintained, but ForwardMethods.jl is pretty sweet and seems to do what I need (and even more). The timing couldn't be better as it completed registration yesterday!

I can now nuke my repo and close this registration PR, MethodForwarding.jl no longer has a reason to exist.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]
